See its game statistics in the {@creature Drake Companion|UA2020SubclassesPt5} stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. When you summon the drake, choose a damage type listed in its Draconic Essence trait. You can determine the cosmetic characteristics of the drake such as its color, scale texture, or any visible effect of its Draconic Essence; your choice has no effect on its game statistics.

In combat, the drake shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge} action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are {@condition incapacitated}, the drake can take any action of its choice, not just {@action Dodge}.
Once you summon the drake, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher to summon it.

The drake remains for a number of hours equal to your proficiency bonus, until it is reduced to 0 hit points, until you use this feature to summon the drake again, or until you die. Anything the drake was wearing or carrying is left behind when the drake vanishes.

subclassFeature.name: 額外攻擊
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of Fang and Scale
entries: {@i 7th-level Drakewarden feature}
The bond you share with your drake intensifies, protecting you and stoking the drake's fury. While your drake is summoned, you and the drake gain the following benefits:

items: You gain resistance to the damage type chosen for the drake's Draconic Essence.
Choose one of the following: the drake gains a swimming speed of 40 feet and can breathe both air and water, or the drake grows wings and gains a flying speed of 40 feet.
The drake's bite attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the type chosen for its Draconic Essence.

subclassFeature.name: Drake's Breath
entries: {@i 11th-level Drakewarden feature}

As an action, you can exhale a 30-foot cone of damaging breath or cause your drake to exhale it. Choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage. Each creature in the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 6d6} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
This damage increases to {@dice 8d6} when you reach 15th level in this class.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Perfected Bond
entries: {@i 15th-level Drakewarden feature}
Your bond to your drake reaches the pinnacle of its power. While your drake is summoned, you and the drake gain the following benefits:

items: The drake grows to Large size.
The drake's bite attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the type chosen for its Draconic Essence (for a total of {@damage 2d6} extra damage).
When either you or the drake takes damage while you're within 30 feet of each other, you can use your reaction to give yourself or the drake resistance to that instance of damage.

subclassFeature.name: 怪物殺手
entries: {@note Note that this subclass is intended for use with the Ranger class presented in the Player's Handbook. It is presented here for convenience, and may be unsuitable for use as a Revised Ranger subclass.}

Rangers of the Slayer Conclave seek out vampires, dragons, evil fey, fiends, and other powerful magical threats. Trained in a variety of arcane and divine techniques to overcome such monsters, slayers are experts at unearthing and defeating mighty foes.

subclassFeature.name: Slayer's Eye
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the ability to study and unravel a creature's defenses. As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 120 feet of you. You immediately learn the target's vulnerabilities, immunities, and resistances. You also learn any special effects triggered when the target takes damage, such as fire damage halting its regeneration.
In addition, the first time each turn you hit the target with a weapon attack, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage from the weapon.
This benefit lasts until you target a different creature with this feature or until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Slayer's Mysticism
entries: You learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Slayer Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you but doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: 額外攻擊
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: 超常防禦
entries: At 7th level, you gain extra resilience against your prey's assaults on your mind and body. Whenever the target of your Slayer's Eye forces you to make a saving throw, add {@dice 1d6} to your roll.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless Slayer
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to foil your foe's ability to escape. Your study of folklore and arcane knowledge gives you a key insight to keep your prey cornered. If the target of your Slayer's Eye attempts to teleport, change its shape, travel to another plane of existence, or turn gaseous, you can use your reaction to make a Wisdom check contested by a Wisdom check made by the target. To use this ability, you must be able to see the target and need to be within 30 feet of it. If you succeed, you foil its attempt, causing it to waste the action, bonus action, or reaction it used.

subclassFeature.name: 殺手反制
entries: At 15th level, you gain the ability to counterattack when your prey tries to sabotage you. If the target of your Slayer's Eye forces you to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to make one weapon attack against it. You make this attack immediately before making the saving throw. If the attack hits, your save automatically succeeds, in addition to the attack's normal effects.

subclassFeature.name: Swarmkeeper
entries: {@note Note that this subclass is intended for use with the Ranger class presented in the Player's Handbook. It is presented here for convenience, and may be unsuitable for use as a Revised Ranger subclass.}

Feeling a deep connection to the world around them, some rangers reach out through their magical connection to nature and gather a host of fey spirits, which take the form of swarming beasts—be they buzzing insects, fluttering birds, slippery squids, or otherwise. The swarm becomes a potent force in battle, as well as helpful—if potentially disturbing—company for the ranger. Some Swarmkeepers are outcasts or hermits, keeping to themselves and their attendant swarms rather than dealing with the discomfort of others. Other Swarmkeepers enjoy building vibrant communities that work for the mutual benefit of all those they consider part of their swarm.

subclassFeature.name: Gathered Swarm
entries: {@i 3rd-level Swarmkeeper feature}

You magically attract a swarm of fey spirits that look like Tiny beasts of your choice. The swarm remains in your space, crawling on you or through your clothing, or flying and skittering immediately around you within your space.

As a bonus action, you can agitate the swarm for 1 minute. For the duration, some of the swarm clings to your weapons or follows your strikes when you attack: once during each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage to that creature, and the swarm moves the creature up to 5 feet toward you or away from you (your choice). At 11th level, the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d6}.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Swarmkeeper Magic
entries: {@i 3rd-level Swarmkeeper feature}

You learn the mage hand cantrip if you don't already know it. When you cast it, the hand takes the form of swarming nature spirits. You also learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Swarmkeeper Spells table. These spells count as ranger spells for you, but don't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: 額外攻擊
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Writhing Tide
entries: {@i 7th-level Swarmkeeper feature}
You can condense part of your swarm into a focused mass that lifts or sweeps you along. Whenever you activate your Gathered Swarm feature, choose one of the following additional benefits:

items: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet, and you can take the {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action.
You gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed. You can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without making an ability check.
You gain a flying speed of 10 feet and can hover.

subclassFeature.name: Gathered Swarm Improvement
entries: {@i 11th-level Swarmkeeper feature}
The extra damage from your swarm increases to {@dice 2d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Scuttling Eyes
entries: {@i 11th-level Swarmkeeper feature}

As an action, you can magically form one of the spirits of your swarm into the shape of a Tiny beast of your choice. The transformation lasts for 1 hour, at which point the spirit disappears. For the duration, the spirit has a speed of 40 feet, which it can use to walk, climb, fly, or swim. The spirit has your senses and telepathically relays what it sees and hears to you. During your turn, you can speak through the spirit, telepathically command it to move, and it can {@action Hide} using your bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks. The spirit has AC 18. If it takes damage, you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 10, or half the damage dealt, whichever is higher) or the spirit disappears.
As an action, you can dismiss the spirit early. If you do, you can magically teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of where the spirit disappeared.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also use it again by expending a spell slot of 3rd level or higher.

subclassFeature.name: Storm of Minions
entries: {@i 15th-level Swarmkeeper feature}

Your swarm can expel a seething storm of spirits that drains life from others. As an action, you create a magical sphere filled with an enraged swarm centered on a point you can see within 120 feet of you. The sphere has a 10-foot-radius and lasts for 1 minute. The sphere is difficult terrain for creatures other than you. A creature other than you that starts its turn in the sphere's area must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage and is {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded}. At the start of your turn, if any number of Small or larger creatures took necrotic damage from the swarm, you regain {@dice 1d8} hit points. On subsequent turns, you can use a bonus action to move the sphere up to 30 feet.
When you activate this feature, you can choose any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also use it again by expending a spell slot of 4th level or higher.

subclassFeature.name: 境界行者
entries: {@note Note that this subclass is intended for use with the Ranger class presented in the Player's Handbook. It is presented here for convenience, and may be unsuitable for use as a Revised Ranger subclass.}

Rangers of the Horizon Conclave guard the world against threats that originate from other planes. They seek out planar portals and keep watch over them, venturing to the outer and inner planes as needed to defeat threats.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Horizon Walker Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, and it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Warrior
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to draw on the energy of the planes to augment your attacks.

As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. Until the end of this turn, your attacks against that creature ignore its damage resistances, and the next time you hit it on this turn, it takes an additional {@damage 1d6} force damage.

subclassFeature.name: Portal Lore
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to detect the presence of planar portals. As an action, you detect the distance and direction to any planar portals within 1,000 feet of you. You also sense which plane of existence each portal leads to. However, if magic obscures any details of a portal, this feature doesn't reveal them.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. Alternatively, you can use the feature again if you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher.
See the "Planar Travel" section in chapter 2 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for examples of planar portals.

subclassFeature.name: 額外攻擊
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: 靈界漫步
entries: At 7th level, you learn to step through the Ethereal Plane. As a bonus action on your turn, you can cast the {@spell 跨入乙太界} spell with this feature, but the spell ends at the end of the current turn. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: 閃現打擊
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to step between the planes in a blink of an eye. When you use the {@action Attack} action, you can teleport up to 10 feet before each attack. You must be able to see the destination of the teleportation.
If you attack at least two different creatures with the action, you can make one additional attack with it against a third creature.

subclassFeature.name: 虛體防禦
entries: At 15th level, your ability to move between planes becomes even more finely tuned. As a reaction when you take damage, you can halve that damage against you. For a moment, you slip into the planar boundary to lessen the harm.

subclassFeature.name: Primeval Guardian
entries: {@note Note that this subclass is intended for use with the Ranger class presented in the Player's Handbook. It is presented here for convenience, and may be unsuitable for use as a Revised Ranger subclass.}

Rangers of the Primeval Guardian Conclave follow an ancient tradition rooted in powerful druidic magic. These rangers learn to become one with nature, allowing them to channel the aspects of various beasts and plants in order to overcome their foes.

These rangers dwell in the elder forests of the world. They venture out only rarely, as they consider it their sacred duty to protect the druidic groves and ancient trees that saw the earliest days of the world.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Primeval Guardian Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, and it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian Soul
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the ability to temporarily grow and take on the appearance of a treelike person, covered with leaves and bark. As a bonus action, you assume this guardian form, which lasts until you end it as a bonus action or until you are {@condition incapacitated}.
You undergo the following changes while in your guardian form:

items: Your size becomes Large, unless you were larger.
Any speed you have becomes 5 feet, unless the speed was lower.
Your reach increases by 5 feet.
You gain a number of temporary hit points at the start of each of your turns. The number equals half your ranger level. When the form ends, you lose any temporary hit points you have from it.

subclassFeature.name: Piercing Thorns
entries: At 3rd level, your command of primal magic allows you to enhance your attacks with thorns. Once during each of your turns, you can deal an additional {@damage 1d6} piercing damage to one creature you hit with a weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: 額外攻擊
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Ancient Fortitude
entries: At 7th level, you gain the endurance of the ancient forests. Your hit point maximum and current hit points increase by 2 per ranger level when you assume your guardian form. This increase lasts until you leave the form; your hit point maximum then returns to normal, but your current hit points remain the same, unless they must decrease to abide by your hit point maximum.

subclassFeature.name: Rooted Defense
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to twist and turn the ground beneath you. While you are in your guardian form, the ground within 30 feet of you is difficult terrain for your enemies.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian Aura
entries: Starting at 15th level, your guardian form emanates a magical aura that fortifies your injured allies. When any ally starts their turn within 30 feet of your guardian form, that ally regains a number of hit points equal to half your ranger level. This aura has no effect on a creature that has half or more of its hit points, and it has no effect on undead and constructs.

subclassFeature.name: 野獸密會 (UA)
entries: 許多遊俠在野外比在文明中會更加自在，以至於甚至動物們會將他們視為同類。野獸密會的遊俠們與一頭野獸建立起了緊密的聯繫，並透過魔法進一步強化了這種聯繫。

subclassFeature.name: 動物夥伴
entries: 在3級時，你習得使用你的魔法以和一頭自然世界中的生物建立一道強大的聯繫。

藉由8小時的作業以及消耗價值50金幣的稀有草藥和上好食物，你可以從荒野中喚來一頭野獸作為你忠實的夥伴。通常來說，你會從下列動物中選擇你的夥伴：{@creature 猿}、{@creature 黑熊}、{@creature 野豬}、{@creature 巨獾}、{@creature 巨鼬鼠}、{@creature 騾子}、{@creature 黑豹}、或{@creature 狼}。然而，你的DM可能會根據周遭地形環境、並考慮能夠在該區域中合理存在的動物類型，以從這些動物中為你挑選一種。
在這8小時的活動結束時，你的動物夥伴將會出現，並獲得所有你動物夥伴聯繫能力所賦予的好處。你同時只能擁有一個動物夥伴。
若你的動物夥伴被殺死，則你與牠之間的魔法聯繫將讓你得以使牠起死回生。藉由8小時的作業並消耗價值25金幣的稀有草藥和上好食物，你可以喚回你動物夥伴的靈魂並使用你的魔法為牠窗造一具新的身體。你可以透過這個方式將你的動物夥伴起死回生，即使你沒有任何牠的身體部位也一樣。
若你當下擁有一名動物夥伴，且使用這個能力將你的前一個動物夥伴起死回生，則你當下擁有的動物夥伴將離開你，且由被復活的動物夥伴取而代之。

subclassFeature.name: 動物夥伴聯繫
entries: 你的動物夥伴將因牠與你之間的聯繫而獲得許多的好處。
若動物夥伴具有多重攻擊的動作項，則牠將失去該動作項。
動物夥伴將盡其所能地服從你的命令。它將如同其他生物一樣骰自己的先攻，但由你決定牠的動作、選擇、態度，諸如此類。若你陷入{@condition 無力}或不在場，則你的動物夥伴將自己行動。
當你使用你的自然探索者能力時，你和你的動物夥伴都能夠以正常步調隱匿移動。
你動物夥伴的能力和遊戲數據將有一部份是由你的等級決定。你的動物夥伴使用你的熟練加值，而非牠自己的。除了原本會使用其熟練加值的部分之外，牠還會將其熟練加值加到牠的AC和傷害骰上。
你的動物夥伴將熟練於二個你所選擇的技能。牠同時將熟練於所有的豁免檢定。
在3級之後，你每提升一級，你的動物夥伴都將因此獲得一顆額外的生命骰，且增加牠相應的生命值。
每當你獲得屬性值提升的職業能力，你動物夥伴的屬性值也將獲得提升。你的動物夥伴可以將一項你所選擇的屬性值提升2點，或著你可以將二項你所選擇的屬性值各提升1點。如同平常一樣，除非另有說明，否則你的動物夥伴不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至20或以上。
你的動物夥伴擁有與你相同的陣營，且它具有一個個性特質和缺點，你可以從下表中選擇或擲骰決定。你的動物夥伴擁有與你相同的理念，且牠的羈絆永遠是「和我同行的遊俠是我願意為之獻身的摯愛夥伴。」
你的動物夥伴獲得你的宿敵能力、以及你在6級時獲得的高等宿敵能力所賦予的好處。牠將使用你所選擇的宿敵做為牠的宿敵。

entries.caption: 動物夥伴特質
rows: 我在面對逆境時毫不畏懼。
威脅我的朋友，就是威脅我。
我會保持警戒，讓其他人得以休息。
人們會將我視為動物並低估我。
我有著會在關鍵時刻現身登場的訣竅。
對所有的一切，我將我朋友的需求擺在我自己之前。

entries.caption: 動物夥伴缺點
rows: 如果有無人看管的食物，我就會把它吃了。
我會對陌生人低吼。而對我來說，除了我的遊俠夥伴之外，所有人都是陌生人。
任何時候都是撓肚子撒嬌的好時候。
我對於招呼的認識就是不停地舔對方的臉。
我會跳向一個生物以表示我有多愛他們！

subclassFeature.name: 偕同攻擊
entries: 從5級開始，你和你的動物夥伴將組成更加強大的戰鬥之力。當你在你的回合採取{@action 攻擊}動作時，若你的動物夥伴可以看見你，則牠可以使用牠的反應以進行一次近戰攻擊。

subclassFeature.name: 野獸防禦
entries: 在7級時，若你的動物夥伴可以看見你，則牠所進行的所有豁免檢定都將具有優勢。

subclassFeature.name: 爪牙風暴
entries: 在11級時，你的動物夥伴可以使用牠的動作對每個距離牠5呎內且牠選擇的生物進行一次近戰攻擊，為每個目標進行各自的攻擊檢定。

subclassFeature.name: 卓越野獸防禦
entries: 在15級時，每當一個你的動物夥伴可以看見的攻擊者以一次攻擊命中牠時，牠可以使用牠的反應已將該次攻擊對牠造成的傷害減半。

subclassFeature.name: 深域追跡者密會 (UA)
entries: 大部分的人們只會在最急迫情況下，為了執行艱困絕望的任務或尋求巨大的財富，才會鋌而走險進入幽暗地域的深處。通常來說，邪惡總會在這地底深處悄悄滋生，而深域追跡者密會的遊俠們則致力於在這類威脅崛起到地表世界之前就發掘並摧毀它們。

entries.subclassFeature: 深域追蹤者魔法|Ranger (Revised)|UATheRangerRevised|Deep Stalker Conclave|UATheRangerRevised|3
幽暗地域斥候|Ranger (Revised)|UATheRangerRevised|Deep Stalker Conclave|UATheRangerRevised|3

subclassFeature.name: 深域追蹤者魔法
entries: 在3級時，你獲得90呎範圍的黑暗視覺。若你已經擁有黑暗視覺，則它的範圍將增加30呎。你也在本職業升至3級、5級、9級、13級、和15級時學會額外的法術。當你獲得一個深域追跡者法術時，它對你而言將被視作遊俠法術，但並不會計入你已知遊俠法術的數量中。

subclassFeature.name: 幽暗地域斥候
entries: 在3級時，你精通於伏擊的藝術。在戰鬥中你的第一個回合期間，你的移動速度獲得+10加值，且若你在該回合採取{@action 攻擊}動作，則你可以進行一次額外攻擊。你同時擅長於避開依賴於黑暗視覺的生物。當你處於微光光照或黑暗環境時，這類生物在嘗試察覺你的存在時並不會獲得任何好處。此外，當DM要判斷你是否可以對一個生物進行躲藏時，該生物不會獲得任何來自黑暗視覺的好處。

subclassFeature.name: 額外攻擊
entries: 從5級開始，每當你在你的回合採取{@action 攻擊}動作，你可以攻擊二次，而非一次。

subclassFeature.name: 鋼鐵心智
entries: 在7級時，你獲得睿知豁免的熟練。

subclassFeature.name: 追獵如風
entries: 從11級開始，在你的每個回合一次，當你的一次攻擊失手時，你可以進行另一次攻擊。你在使用次能力的回合期間獲得一次額外的攻擊。

subclassFeature.name: 追獵者閃避
entries: 在15級時，每當一個生物對你進行一次攻擊檢定且該檢定不具有優勢時，你可以使用你的反應以讓該生物對你進行的攻擊檢定承受劣勢。你可以在該攻擊檢定擲骰之前獲知後決定是否使用此能力，但必須在決定該次檢定的結果之前使用。

subclassFeature.name: 獵人密會 (UA)
entries: 有些遊俠尋求透過精通武器以更好的從荒野的威脅中守護文明世界。獵人密會的成員學習了特化的戰鬥技巧，用以對抗最可怕的威脅：從狂怒的食人魔、成群的獸人、到高聳的巨人和可怖的巨龍。

subclassFeature.name: 滅族者
entries: 在你的每個回合一次，當你進行一次武器攻擊時，你可以使用相同的武器對一個距離原本目標5呎內，且處於你武器射程內的另一個生物進行另一次攻擊。

subclassFeature.name: 狩者獵物
entries: 在3級時，你獲得下列其中一個你所選擇的能力：巨怪獵者、巨人殺手、或滅族者。

subclassFeature.name: 巨怪獵者
entries: 你的執著可以毀滅最強大的敵人。當你以一次武器攻擊命中一個生物，若它的生命值低於最大值，則該生物將受到額外的{@dice 1d8}傷害。你每回合只能造成一次這個額外傷害。

subclassFeature.name: 巨人殺手
entries: 當一個距離你5呎內，體型為大型或更大的生物對你進行的一次攻擊命中或失手時，只要你可以看見該生物，你就可以使用你的反應以立刻在它的攻擊之後對它進行攻擊。

subclassFeature.name: 額外攻擊
entries: 從5級開始，每當你在你的回合採取{@action 攻擊}動作，你可以攻擊二次，而非一次。

subclassFeature.name: 防禦性戰術
entries: 在7級時，你獲得下列其中一個你所選擇的能力：逃離眾敵、防禦多重攻擊、或鋼鐵意志。

subclassFeature.name: 逃離眾敵
entries: 所有對你進行的藉機攻擊將具有劣勢。

subclassFeature.name: 防禦多重攻擊
entries: 當一個生物以一次攻擊命中你時，你的AC將對該生物在該回合中所進行的所有後續攻擊獲得+4的加值。

subclassFeature.name: 鋼鐵意志
entries: 你在對抗{@condition 恐懼}的豁免檢定中具有優勢。

subclassFeature.name: 多重攻擊
entries: 在11級時，你獲得下列其中一個你所選擇的能力：箭雨、或劍刃風暴。

subclassFeature.name: 箭雨
entries: 你可以使用你的動作以進行一次遠程攻擊，並以處於你武器射程內你所能看見一點的周圍10呎範圍內的任意數量個生物做為目標。你必須有足夠的彈藥以攻擊每個目標，且你為每個目標進行各自的攻擊檢定。

subclassFeature.name: 劍刃風暴
entries: 你可以使用你的動作以進行一次近戰攻擊，並以距離你5呎內的任意數量個生物做為目標，為每個目標進行各自的攻擊檢定。

subclassFeature.name: 反射閃避
entries: 你可以靈活地躲開某些範圍效果，像是紅龍的火焰吐息、或{@spell 閃電束}法術。當你成為一個允許你進行敏捷豁免以僅承受一半傷害的效果的目標時，你改為在豁免成功時不受任何傷害，且在豁免失敗時僅承受一半傷害。

subclassFeature.name: 逆潮而立
entries: 當一個敵對生物對你進行的一次近戰攻擊失手，你可以使用你的反應以強迫該生物對你所選擇的另一個生物（除了它自己以外）重複進行一次該攻擊。

subclassFeature.name: 卓越獵人防禦
entries: 在15級時，你獲得下列其中一個你所選擇的能力：反射閃避、逆潮而立、或直覺閃避。

subclassFeature.name: 直覺閃避
entries: 當一個你所能看見的攻擊者使用一次攻擊命中你，你可以使用你的反應以減半該次攻擊對你的傷害。

subclassFeature.name: 幽域追蹤者
entries: {@note Note that this subclass is intended for use with the Ranger class presented in the Player's Handbook. It is presented here for convenience, and may be unsuitable for use as a Revised Ranger subclass.}

Gloom Stalkers are at home in the darkest places: deep under the earth, in gloomy alleyways, in primeval forests, and wherever else the light dims. Most folk enter such places with trepidation, but a Gloom Stalker ventures boldly into the darkness, seeking to ambush threats before they can reach the broader world. Such rangers are often found in the Underdark, but they will go any place where evil lurks in the shadows.

subclassFeature.name: 懼怖伏兵
entries: At 3rd level, you master the art of the ambush. You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier.

At the start of your first turn of each combat, your walking speed increases by 10 feet, which lasts until the end of that turn. If you take the {@action Attack} action on that turn, you can make one additional weapon attack as part of that action. If that attack hits, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} damage of the weapon's damage type.

subclassFeature.name: 幽域追蹤者魔法
entries: 從3級開始，當你在本職業升至特定等級，你將學會額外的法術，如幽域追蹤者法術表所示。這些法術對你而言視作遊俠法術，但並不會計入你已知遊俠法術的數量中。

subclassFeature.name: 幽影視覺
entries: At 3rd level, you gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision} from your race, its range increases by 30 feet.

You are also adept at evading creatures that rely on {@sense darkvision}. While in darkness, you are {@condition invisible} to any creature that relies on {@sense darkvision} to see you in that darkness.

subclassFeature.name: 額外攻擊
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: 鋼鐵心智
entries: By 7th level, you have honed your ability to resist the mind-altering powers of your prey. You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws. If you already have this proficiency, you instead gain proficiency in Intelligence or Charisma saving throws (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: 追獵如風
entries: At 11th level, you learn to attack with such unexpected speed that you can turn a miss into another strike. Once on each of your turns when you miss with a weapon attack, you can make another weapon attack as part of the same action.

subclassFeature.name: 暗影閃避
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can dodge in unforeseen ways, with wisps of supernatural shadow around you. Whenever a creature makes an attack roll against you and doesn't have advantage on the roll, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on it. You must use this feature before you know the outcome of the attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: 境界行者
entries: {@note Note that this subclass is intended for use with the Ranger class presented in the Player's Handbook. It is presented here for convenience, and may be unsuitable for use as a Revised Ranger subclass.}

Horizon Walkers guard the world against threats that originate from other planes or that seek to ravage the mortal realm with otherworldly magic. They seek out planar portals and keep watch over them, venturing to the Inner Planes and the Outer Planes as needed to pursue their foes. These rangers are also friends to any forces in the multiverse—especially benevolent dragons, fey, and elementals—that work to preserve life and the order of the planes.

subclassFeature.name: 偵測傳送門
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to magically sense the presence of a planar portal. As an action, you detect the distance and direction to the closest planar portal within 1 mile of you.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
See the "Planar Travel" section in chapter 2 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for examples of planar portals.

subclassFeature.name: 境界行者魔法
entries: 從3級開始，當你在本職業升至特定等級，你將學會額外的法術，如境界行者法術表所示。這些法術對你而言視作遊俠法術，但並不會計入你已知遊俠法術的數量中。

subclassFeature.name: 位面戰士
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to draw on the energy of the multiverse to augment your attacks.

As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The next time you hit that creature on this turn with a weapon attack, all damage dealt by the attack becomes force damage, and the creature takes an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage from the attack. When you reach 11th level in this class, the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d8}.

subclassFeature.name: 額外攻擊
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: 靈界漫步
entries: At 7th level, you learn to step through the Ethereal Plane. As a bonus action, you can cast the {@spell 跨入乙太界} spell with this feature, without expending a spell slot, but the spell ends at the end of the current turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: 閃現打擊
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to pass between the planes in the blink of an eye. When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can teleport up to 10 feet before each attack to an unoccupied space you can see.
If you attack at least two different creatures with the action, you can make one additional attack with it against a third creature.

subclassFeature.name: 虛體防禦
entries: At 15th level, your ability to move between planes enables you to slip through the planar boundaries to lessen the harm done to you during battle. When you take damage from an attack, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to all of that attack's damage on this turn.

subclassFeature.name: 怪物殺手
entries: {@note Note that this subclass is intended for use with the Ranger class presented in the Player's Handbook. It is presented here for convenience, and may be unsuitable for use as a Revised Ranger subclass.}

You have dedicated yourself to hunting down creatures of the night and wielders of grim magic. A Monster Slayer seeks out vampires, dragons, evil fey, fiends, and other magical threats. Trained in supernatural techniques to overcome such monsters, slayers are experts at unearthing and defeating mighty, mystical foes.

subclassFeature.name: 獵人感知
entries: 在3級時，你獲得凝視一個生物並以魔法知悉傷害它最佳的方式的能力。以一個動作，選擇一個距離你60呎內且你所能看見的生物。你將立刻知道該生物是否擁有任何傷害免疫、抗性、或是易傷，以及它們的種類。若該生物不受預言系魔法影響，則你感知到的結果將會是它不具有任何傷害免疫、抗性、和易傷。
你可以使用此能力的次數等同於你的睿知調整值（最少一次）。你在完成一次長休後恢復所有你花費掉的次數。

subclassFeature.name: 怪物殺手魔法
entries: 從3級開始，當你在本職業升至特定等級，你將學會額外的法術，如怪物殺手法術表所示。這些法術對你而言視作遊俠法術，但並不會計入你已知遊俠法術的數量中。

subclassFeature.name: 殺手獵物
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can focus your ire on one foe, increasing the harm you inflict on it. As a bonus action, you designate one creature you can see within 60 feet of you as the target of this feature. The first time each turn that you hit that target with a weapon attack, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage from the weapon.
This benefit lasts until you finish a short or long rest. It ends early if you designate a different creature.

subclassFeature.name: 額外攻擊
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: 超常防禦
entries: At 7th level, you gain extra resilience against your prey's assaults on your mind and body. Whenever the target of your Slayer's Prey forces you to make a saving throw and whenever you make an ability check to escape that target's grapple, add {@dice 1d6} to your roll.

subclassFeature.name: 魔法剋星
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to thwart someone else's magic. When you see a creature casting a spell or teleporting within 60 feet of you, you can use your reaction to try to magically foil it. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC, or its spell or teleport fails and is wasted.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: 殺手反制
entries: At 15th level, you gain the ability to counterattack when your prey tries to sabotage you. If the target of your Slayer's Prey forces you to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to make one weapon attack against the quarry. You make this attack immediately before making the saving throw. If your attack hits, your save automatically succeeds, in addition to the attack's normal effects.
